intro: Polygonum tanganikae var. ciliatum, commonly known as the Tanganyikan knotweed, is a species native to the Lake Tanganyika region in East Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The leaves are often hairy and have ciliate margins, giving the plant its specific epithet "ciliatum." It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. This plant thrives in moist, rocky habitats and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native environment.
